verses.kjv: Now will I sing to my wellbeloved a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My wellbeloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill:
verses.web: Let me sing for my well beloved a song of my beloved about his vineyard. My beloved had a vineyard on a very fruitful hill.
verses.ct: Let me sing a song for the one I love — a song about his vineyard. My beloved had a vineyard on a rich, fertile hillside.

verses.kjv: And he fenced it, and gathered out the stones thereof, and planted it with the choicest vine, and built a tower in the midst of it, and also made a winepress therein: and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.
verses.web: He dug it up, gathered out its stones, planted it with the choicest vine, built a tower in the middle of it, and also cut out a wine press in it. He looked for it to yield grapes, but it yielded wild grapes.
verses.ct: He dug up the soil, cleared away the stones, and planted the finest vines. He built a watchtower in the middle of it and carved out a winepress. He expected it to produce good grapes, but it only grew wild, worthless ones.

verses.kjv: And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard.
verses.web: “Now, inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah, please judge between me and my vineyard.
verses.ct: "Now then, people of Jerusalem and Judah — you be the judge between me and my vineyard.

verses.kjv: What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it? wherefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes, brought it forth wild grapes?
verses.web: What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it? Why, when I looked for it to yield grapes, did it yield wild grapes?
verses.ct: What more could I have done for my vineyard that I haven't already done? Why did it produce wild grapes when I expected good ones?

verses.kjv: And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down:
verses.web: Now I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard. I will take away its hedge, and it will be eaten up. I will break down its wall, and it will be trampled down.
verses.ct: Let me tell you what I'm going to do to my vineyard. I'll tear down its hedge, and animals will devour it. I'll break down its wall, and it will be trampled.

verses.kjv: And I will lay it waste: it shall not be pruned, nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns: I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.
verses.web: I will lay it a wasteland. It won’t be pruned or hoed, but it will grow briers and thorns. I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain on it.”
verses.ct: I'll turn it into a wasteland. No one will prune it or tend the soil. Briers and thorns will take over. I'll even command the clouds to hold back their rain."

verses.kjv: For the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plant: and he looked for judgment, but behold oppression; for righteousness, but behold a cry.
verses.web: For the vineyard of LORD of Armies is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plant: and he looked for justice, but, behold, oppression; for righteousness, but, behold, a cry of distress.
verses.ct: Here is what the song means: the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the nation of Israel, and the people of Judah are the plants he lovingly tended. He hoped for justice, but instead found oppression. He looked for righteousness, but heard only cries of distress.

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that join house to house, that lay field to field, till there be no place, that they may be placed alone in the midst of the earth!
verses.web: Woe to those who join house to house, who lay field to field, until there is no room, and you are made to dwell alone in the middle of the land!
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for those who buy up house after house and field after field until no one else has any room, and they live alone in the middle of the land!

verses.kjv: In mine ears said the LORD of hosts, Of a truth many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair, without inhabitant.
verses.web: In my ears, LORD of Armies says: “Surely many houses will be desolate, even great and beautiful, unoccupied.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts declared in my hearing: "Without a doubt, many grand and beautiful houses will stand empty, with no one living in them.

verses.kjv: Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of an homer shall yield an ephah.
verses.web: For ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and a homer of seed shall yield an ephah.”
verses.ct: Ten acres of vineyard will produce only one bath of wine, and a homer of seed will yield just an ephah of grain."

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink; that continue until night, till wine inflame them!
verses.web: Woe to those who rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink, who stay late into the night, until wine inflames them!
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for those who get up early in the morning to chase after strong drink, and stay up late into the night until wine sets them on fire!

verses.kjv: And the harp, and the viol, the tabret, and pipe, and wine, are in their feasts: but they regard not the work of the LORD, neither consider the operation of his hands.
verses.web: The harp, lyre, tambourine, and flute, with wine, are at their feasts; but they don’t respect the work of LORD, neither have they considered the operation of his hands.
verses.ct: Their parties are full of harps, lyres, tambourines, flutes, and wine — but they pay no attention to what the LORD is doing and never consider the work of his hands.

verses.kjv: Therefore my people are gone into captivity, because they have no knowledge: and their honourable men are famished, and their multitude dried up with thirst.
verses.web: Therefore my people go into captivity for lack of knowledge. Their honorable men are famished, and their multitudes are parched with thirst.
verses.ct: Because of this, my people will go into captivity — they simply don't understand. Their leaders will starve, and their crowds will be parched with thirst.

verses.kjv: Therefore hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth without measure: and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it.
verses.web: Therefore Sheol has enlarged its desire, and opened its mouth without measure; and their glory, their multitude, their pomp, and he who rejoices among them, descend into it.
verses.ct: So Sheol has opened its mouth wide, stretching beyond all limits. Down into it will go their splendor, their crowds, their noise, and everyone who celebrates among them.

verses.kjv: And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled:
verses.web: So man is brought low, mankind is humbled, and the eyes of the arrogant ones are humbled;
verses.ct: The common person will be brought low, the powerful will be humbled, and the arrogant will have their proud eyes cast down.

verses.kjv: But the LORD of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.
verses.web: but LORD of Armies is exalted in justice, and God the Holy One is sanctified in righteousness.
verses.ct: But the LORD of hosts will be lifted high through justice, and God, the Holy One, will show himself holy through righteousness.

verses.kjv: Then shall the lambs feed after their manner, and the waste places of the fat ones shall strangers eat.
verses.web: Then the lambs will graze as in their pasture, and strangers will eat the ruins of the rich.
verses.ct: Then lambs will graze freely as if in open pasture, and strangers will feed among the ruins of the wealthy.

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope:
verses.web: Woe to those who draw iniquity with cords of falsehood, and wickedness as with cart rope,
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for those who drag sin behind them with cords of deception, hauling wickedness along like a cart on a rope!

verses.kjv: That say, Let him make speed, and hasten his work, that we may see it: and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know it!
verses.web: who say, “Let him make haste, let him hasten his work, that we may see it; let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come, that we may know it!”
verses.ct: They're the ones who mock God, saying, "Let him hurry up! Let him get on with his work so we can see it! Let the plan of the Holy One of Israel come closer so we can find out what it is!"

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that call evil good, and good evil; that put darkness for light, and light for darkness; that put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!
verses.web: Woe to those who call evil good, and good evil; who put darkness for light, and light for darkness; who put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for those who call evil good and good evil, who turn darkness into light and light into darkness, who make bitter into sweet and sweet into bitter!

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight!
verses.web: Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight!
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for those who think they're so wise, who consider themselves so clever!

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that are mighty to drink wine, and men of strength to mingle strong drink:
verses.web: Woe to those who are mighty to drink wine, and champions at mixing strong drink;
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for those who are champions at drinking wine and experts at mixing strong drink —

verses.kjv: Which justify the wicked for reward, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him!
verses.web: who acquit the guilty for a bribe, but deny justice for the innocent!
verses.ct: who let the guilty go free for a bribe and strip justice away from the innocent!

verses.kjv: Therefore as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust: because they have cast away the law of the LORD of hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
verses.web: Therefore as the tongue of fire devours the stubble, and as the dry grass sinks down in the flame, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust, because they have rejected the law of LORD of Armies, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: So just as fire devours dry stubble and flames consume chaff, their roots will rot and their blossoms will blow away like dust — because they rejected the law of the LORD of hosts and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: Therefore is the anger of the LORD kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them: and the hills did tremble, and their carcases were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.web: Therefore LORD’s anger burns against his people, and he has stretched out his hand against them and has struck them. The mountains tremble, and their dead bodies are as refuse in the middle of the streets. For all this, his anger is not turned away, but his hand is still stretched out.
verses.ct: That is why the LORD's anger burns against his people. He has raised his hand and struck them down. The mountains trembled, and dead bodies lay like garbage in the streets. Yet even after all this, his anger hasn't faded — his hand is still raised to strike.

verses.kjv: And he will lift up an ensign to the nations from far, and will hiss unto them from the end of the earth: and, behold, they shall come with speed swiftly:
verses.web: He will lift up a banner to the nations from far away, and he will whistle for them from the end of the earth. Behold, they will come speedily and swiftly.
verses.ct: He will raise a signal flag for distant nations and whistle for them from the ends of the earth. Watch — they will come racing in, swift and fast.

verses.kjv: None shall be weary nor stumble among them; none shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken:
verses.web: No one shall be weary nor stumble among them; no one shall slumber nor sleep, neither shall the belt of their waist be untied, nor the strap of their sandals be broken,
verses.ct: Not one of them will be tired or stumble. None will drowse or fall asleep. Every belt will be cinched tight, and not a single sandal strap will be broken.

verses.kjv: Whose arrows are sharp, and all their bows bent, their horses’ hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind:
verses.web: whose arrows are sharp, and all their bows bent. Their horses’ hoofs will be like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind.
verses.ct: Their arrows are razor-sharp, and every bow is strung and ready. Their horses' hooves are hard as flint, and their chariot wheels spin like a whirlwind.

verses.kjv: Their roaring shall be like a lion, they shall roar like young lions: yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey, and shall carry it away safe, and none shall deliver it.
verses.web: Their roaring will be like a lioness. They will roar like young lions. Yes, they shall roar, and seize their prey and carry it off, and there will be no one to deliver.
verses.ct: Their battle cry roars like a lioness. They growl like young lions, seizing their prey and carrying it off with no one to rescue it.

verses.kjv: And in that day they shall roar against them like the roaring of the sea: and if one look unto the land, behold darkness and sorrow, and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof.
verses.web: They will roar against them in that day like the roaring of the sea. If one looks to the land, behold, darkness and distress. The light is darkened in its clouds.
verses.ct: On that day, they will roar over Israel like the roaring of the sea. And if anyone looks across the land, all they'll see is darkness and despair — even the light will be swallowed up by the clouds.
